title: Add `--update` option to `spack mirror create` to match latest hashes
body:
Add an option to `spack mirror create` to enable downloading more recent versions of the source in the event of a hash mismatch.

### Rationale

We maintain a mirror of all packages for our site.  We update this periodically (about hourly).  We hit an issue recently where the `libpng` package changed where the source changed and the hash for each version changed with it.  When a user tried to install that package with a recent version of Spack whereas the mirror still had the old versions of the package source.  This threw a hash mismatch error.  The way we can see to update this automatically would be to determine what packages have different hashes, create a separate mirror with those packages, and then move those into place in the production mirror.  Having an option on `spack mirror create` that checks this for us and downloads the latest version that matches the hash in the `package.py` files.

### Description

Implement a `--update` option for `spack mirror create` that will check the hash of files currently in the mirror and replace them if the hash doesn't match.
